title: Getting lots of trolls and afkers in Ranked Bronze
body:
Dear Riot,
I'm taking the time to write because I'm really frustrated at this point.
I've had 5 games in a row, different days and different times, where there is at least one player feeding / afking / trolling, which results in defeat.

Their response to why they do it is that they enjoying getting other people upset.
They are not afraid of the tribunal because apparently they rarely get a ban and if they do is 5 or 20 minutes.

It's ruining my experience and I don't enjoy playing as much as I used to.
If this keeps going on I'm seriously thinking to start playing something else.

I think a good solution would be to have harsher punishments for Ranked games (like 1 week ban).

I believe that getting in a higher ELO would help a lot, as these players won't make it past Bronze, but I'm really struggling with that since trolling is very common (more and more since I started playing).

Please do something about it.

Kind Regards,
Bill.

I can tell you now that AFKers and people that don't do so well in games are still plentiful in all elos (Idk why everyone in low elo thinks it only happens to them). 

Looking through your match history, I can't see any games with intentional feeders, only games with people that aren't playing super great (people in low elo play super inconsistently- look at your own scores). I also have only been able to find one game where an obvious AFK stood out for me. 

>It's ruining my experience and I don't enjoy playing as much as I used to.
If this keeps going on I'm seriously thinking to start playing something else.

If you want to avoid players that you perceive to be ruining your games, the answer is simple; play ranked flex in a 5man. You can avoid everything you just described by handpicking your teammates each and every game. Do a bit of voice chat on discord, have a karaoke party, whatever you feel is needed to make the game fun. 


> They are not afraid of the tribunal because apparently they rarely get a ban and if they do is 5 or 20 minutes.

We don't have a tribunal
5/20 minute bans are only a thing for leaver buster (the AFK detection) and are actually called [low priority queue](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752714-LeaverBuster-FAQ). it places players in a queue that they have to wait 5-20 minutes (x5) before getting into an actual queue. If they continually AFK despite leaver buster punishment, then we start getting into account suspension territory. 

We do have the instant feedback system. If you report accurately (example: not reporting everyone who is having a bad game under "feeding"), then you can be assured that your reports are stacking up against a player 

[the punishments escalate as follows:](http://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/gameplay-balance/Boqd81O0-upcoming-upgrades-to-chat-restrictions)

* 10 game chat restriction
*  25 game chat restriction
* 14 day account ban
* Permanent account ban

Behaviour that is considered severe (like racism/sexism/homophobia) is enough to have you skipping to a punishment tier (although not usually instant perma). 

For games where you can't obviously see what people are doing from that chat logs, be sure to still report them and leave a comment on what they were doing (comment is very important and helps the system learn). It can trigger a manual review of the games, which can also lead to bans[ Example ](http://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/player-behavior-moderation/WQdqZQOw-temp-banned-can-riot-email-me-my-chat-log?comment=0004).

Well, I wish you could look at the in-game chat. Because then you would know what I'm talking about.
I don't know how you can determine that they are not intentionally feeding purely by looking at my match history.

The other thing is, it's not one player and the same player.. there is a lot of them. Well, this is my experience anyway!

Thanks for commenting

Bill

on a riot product.

Well we all have bad days from time to time.

Today, a storm caused a brown/black out.  Couldn't play on the desktop.  Had to get my laptop and use the phones wifi hotspot.  Couldn't log back in until the game was over.  :(  Not sure if it is cause of using a different IP or something, or it was just the laptop load speed or phones connection speed.

I feel sorry for those playing ranked when these events from nature do occur.

Bill, some advice to help you move up is not to let others bad behaviour get to  you.  Never get into arguments, it just increases negative attitudes on your team.



Stage one: focus on your gameplay
Stage two: once you gameplay is good, think about how you can help your team (bolster those that are doing well, and work with them(increasing moral in the team))
Stage three: learn to make shot calls, and setup plays in the team(skill level increases respect, and willingness to listen)

Bronze is filled with a large mix of skill levels, what you may think is someone feeding might be a low skill level playing against a much higher skill level player.  Some of the things i can get away with in bronze would be less effective in silver, and punished in gold or higher.

As a support main, if I am with a low skill level ad, I just ask them to cover my retreat from an engage harrass, not to try and follow up.  Unfortunately many low skill level ad's think they are alot better than they really are, try and follow up and die.   Not listening to reduce pressure game plays.

I'm not talking about feeding unintentionally because it happens to me as well sometimes... I'm talking specifically about players that feed intentionally or afk intentionally. How do I know they're doing it? They told me themselves!!! It's so frustrating.

I'm not a negative player and I hate toxicity so I never flame if someone is feeding because they got countered or because their skill level is lower than that of their opponent. But I do get upset when they do it intentionally to ruin everyone's game.

Thanks for your comment Strewth. I appreciate your recommendation and I will try to follow them.
